definition: to take a screen test/to audition/screen test/audition/tryout
to test/to try/experiment/examination/test
mirror/lens
screen test

sentences.english: On the way back in the audition, just hit the ice to big style waterfront.
sentences.chinese: 在試鏡回來的路上，正好碰着傍到大款的冰。

sentences.english: so that they can do on camera, you know, what they audition for.
sentences.chinese: 這樣他們才能在鏡頭前扮演試鏡的角色。

sentences.english: Joey prepares to audition to play the part of a 19-year-old.
sentences.chinese: 喬伊準備參加一個試鏡，演19歲少年。

sentences.english: We think you are very photogenic and would be suitable for our Casting Division.
sentences.chinese: 我們認爲你非常上鏡，很適合我們的試鏡組。

sentences.english: He asked if she would like to go the film studio to do a test, and she thought he was joking.
sentences.chinese: 他問她是否願意去攝影室去試鏡，而她想他在開玩笑。

sentences.english: It wasn't long before the young beauty was noticed and invited to take a screen test.
sentences.chinese: 沒過多久，這個小美人就被邀請到好萊塢試鏡。

sentences.english: Get tips for memorizing your lines in this free video clip about on camera auditions.
sentences.chinese: 找記憶在此免費視頻剪輯約在鏡頭試鏡臺詞提示。

sentences.english: Linda lack of confidence, for the constant day Linda has promised to attend the audition.
sentences.chinese: 嘉欣欠缺信心，天恆替嘉欣答應出席試鏡。

sentences.english: I talk about, like, things that happen in school, and 1)auditioning .
sentences.chinese: 在書裏，我談到了上學時以及試鏡的事情。

sentences.english: or they go to any auditions that come about.
After a screen test, Khan was given the role of Princess Yashodhara.
sentences.chinese: 經過試鏡，薩爾曼給了她公主的角色。

sentences.english: That very Saturday we went to the audition.
sentences.chinese: 在那個週六，我和父親去參加了試鏡。

sentences.english: Rare footage from inside a Jessica Alba audition.
sentences.chinese: 傑西卡阿爾芭試鏡中的罕見鏡頭。

sentences.english: What Is Slating in On Camera Auditions?
sentences.chinese: 什麼是時間將爲在關於相機試鏡？。

sentences.english: Then we screened over 10,000 actresses to get to her.
sentences.chinese: 所以我就在10000個試鏡的女演員中挑了湯唯。

definition: to amaze the world with a single brilliant feat (idiom); an overnight celebrity
to win instant success (idiom)/to become an instant hit
to call for entries and select the best/to solicit (entries, submissions, applications etc)/to select (the best candidate)/contest/competition
to act/to play a part
to be popular/to be in luck/to have good luck/to develop smoothly
first publication/maiden work
slot within a schedule/timeslot (for a TV program, a session with a photographer etc)/range of dates in which an event is to be held (film screening, exhibition etc)
Hollywood
to reveal outstanding talent (idiom); to stand out as conspicuously brilliant
to be a big hit/to be hugely popular
romantic comedy
to select talented individuals/(sports) draft
to hit the big time
